---
  title: "Writing & Presentations"

I have written 24 academic papers, two books ([Using R as a GIS](rgis.html) and [GIS: Research Methods ](gis-research-methods.html)) and given over 25 presentations at a variety of conferences and seminars. I have also published in a number of magazines and industry journals, including [The Conversation](https://theconversation.com/uk), [xyHt](https://www.xyht.com/), and [GeoConnexionUK](https://www.geoconnexion.com/). Links are included below, but if you can't find anything, [please ask](http://nickbearman.github.io).

## Sonification - PhD

My PhD research focused on the use of sonification, or using sound to represent data. I was particularly interested in using sound to represent spatial data, and how it could be best combined with visual representations of data. 

**Bearman, N. (2013)** Using Sound to Represent Uncertainty in Spatial Data. PhD Thesis, University of East Anglia. [![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/DOI/10.5281/zenodo.13809573.svg)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13809573) ![](images/pdf.gif){alt=""} [Thesis (6.5 MB)](https://zenodo.org/records/13809573/files/2013BearmanNEPhD.pdf?download=1), [Data (201 MB)](https://zenodo.org/records/13809573/files/data_files.zip?download=1).

Alongside my these and related data files (above) I also have a range of resources and videos that might be useful.
